Reviews.Title: No volume?!
Reviews.Author: M. Wu
Reviews.Content: This TV was just ok.  The price was good, the delivery was fine from amazon, the picture quality/color was good too. However, a major problem is the volume! Even at the MAXIMUM setting, it was maybe a medium for other TVs.  There are just no speakers anywhere that's visible. It's too bad...

Reviews.Title: Horrible audio, try the LG instead.
Reviews.Author: A Writer
Reviews.Content: I ordered two of these. One was perfect. The other had a grey oval on the screen whenever displaying something dark on the TV. I think there are some quality control issues with Sharp recently --- in the past Sharp made excellent television. The main reason that I am writing this review is to talk about the sound quality. I bought this for a bedroom in a vacation home, and I really wasn't expecting anything particularly wonderful, but I did expect it to produce sound adequate to be able to listen to ordinary tv. The audio quality is pretty bad. It has two 10w speakers that point down/back. My first Sharp TV was only 26" and had forward facing speakers --- it still works and produces amazing sound. During the last decade, Sharp has stopped providing superior audio and has replaced it with not just sub-standard but unacceptable quality audio. I returned the TV with the grey oval, but kept the other for a guest room that is only occupied approximately 15 days a year. After reading Consumers Reports, I bought the LG 32LN5300 32-Inch LED-lit 1080p television set, and the quality was much better than this sharp at only a few dollars more. B00BB0ZTM2I recommend that you get the LG instead of this Sharp. Not only is the picture quality on the LG better, but the sound is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: everything is great for this TV
Reviews.Author: JIAWEI YUAN
Reviews.Content: I love Sharp all the time, and this TV is great especially for its display. It just looks like as shown in the picture

Reviews.Title: Great television!
Reviews.Author: Amy L.Babb
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv. I would definitely recommend it. The picture is crystal clear. I have the 60 inch too and this smaller one is just as nice.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a reasonable price!
Reviews.Author: P. Preston
Reviews.Content: Works great, great picture and sound isn't too bad.  It's used at a tattoo shop, so we run it 12+ hours a day, 6 days a week to play movies for our customers that are waiting.  Was easy to set up and we've had no problems out of it so far.

Reviews.Title: Nothing better than Aquos!
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: Amazing clarity for a 32" LCD. My 3rd Aquos (currently have 2 others at home) & won't buy another TV until the quality is better than Aquos. A++ deal here on Amazon

Reviews.Title: Very nice led tv. Great looking and great picture
Reviews.Author: Azurak1
Reviews.Content: The led is very nice. The stand is solid not plastic like most these day's. It's got a great picture.. the sound is just ok. But that is what you will get out of a led tv. you I love it. you will to.

Reviews.Title: Love
Reviews.Author: Theresa A. Colon "Teri311"
Reviews.Content: So far so good.  No issues or problems with the TV and the picture and sound are very clear.  Would buy this type/brand again if needed.

Reviews.Title: Sharp...not what they used to be
Reviews.Author: AV Guy
Reviews.Content: I have a couple of other Sharp tvs in the house.  One is a 2012, while the other one is a 2013.  Decent TVs.  Well the 2014 models seem to have some issues.  First TV I received had back light issues.  Amazon exchanged and the second TV worked for around 20 minutes before it started power cycling, and then not coming on at all.  Returned and requested refund.  I bought a different brand.

Reviews.Title: Good picture quality - Low native resolution
Reviews.Author: felipeg
Reviews.Content: I respect Sharp for their picture quality for the money, and this product reflects that. The only thing that makes this a 3 star is the really low native resolution of the display. Terrible for any sort of computer monitor use.You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: It doesn't get any better than this!!!
Reviews.Author: Edwin Skilling
Reviews.Content: I was delighted when I received my new TV and I liked it so much I just purchased another one for my house in Nevada!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for its size.
Reviews.Author: Willa Rolfes
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture and is the perfect size for a smaller room; it's being used in a bedroom.

Reviews.Title: A nice TV
Reviews.Author: Scott "Scott from Amherst"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice TV. It is very basic and has standard features and good picture quality.I bought this TV in particular because it had a headphone jack. However, the jack is on the side of the TV requiring me to physically turn the TV in order to see the jack every time I want to plug in my headphones. It should be on the front!The only other thing to know is that there are only 2 HDMI ports and one set of EITHER component OR Composite inputs - they share, so you cant use both. This seemed like enough when I bought the TV, but I quickly realized this may be limiting over time.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: David Hensley
Reviews.Content: Installed this TV in my exercise room.  Great picture, size and features for that application. Five Stars for a reason!

Reviews.Title: Sharp 32"
Reviews.Author: Layla
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is very good. And it was dropped off at my home before delivery date plus it looks really nice. I love this tv

Reviews.Title: Not a terrible TV, but doesn't come close to my Panasonic of the same size.
Reviews.Author: no
Reviews.Content: This TV is just ok. It does the job. But in comparison to my Panasonic, it doesnt even come close to matching the same sound or picture quality. My Panasonic also has a better menu and in general is heavier and is of a better quality.This TV will get the job done, don't get me wrong, but next time I'll save my money for higher quality.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price. Great quality for a good value.
Reviews.Author: John M. Panzer
Reviews.Content: I've been a Sharp customer since I bought my first LCD TV from them back in 2007. I still have that set and it works just as great as this one does. I've bought Sharp twice since then, (this one and a Quattron) and all of them have yet to disappoint me in terms of manufacturing quality, picture quality, and input capabilities.Setting up the TV was extremely easy. The VESA mounting holes use small screws, so if you are mounting it, you'll save time if you have a friend hold it up for you during installation. When you connect it, there are few screens that you have to go through before you're done. Channel scanning is also very fast, much faster than other sets.The audio from the TV is not all that bad either for general viewing. I have installed this one for a relative who is hard of hearing, and she was able to hear the sound well. Even at loud volumes, the sound does not distort at all.The picture quality is also very clear, and even though it is only a 720p set, it was pleasurable to watch. Color is not overly saturated, and the sharpness of the set is amazing.I would recommend this set to a friend, and this is probably the best bang for your buck in this price range. If the opportunity arises in the next year or so, I might look into purchasing another one of these as well.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PICTURE
Reviews.Author: CECIL ERDLY "Nerds R Us"
Reviews.Content: I bought a Sharp TV and a Winegard flat wave antenna. At first the results were disappointing because our old converter box was receiving more channels using an old rabbit ears antenna without amplification. So I decided to try the attic. The cable and satellite companies left quite an array of cables behind, but the first one I tried was the correct cable. Wow, what a difference. According to the antenna web site, I aimed the antenna at 233 degrees (from Lakeland FL), and received about 45 channels. I thought maybe it was just a good day for radio waves, but the signals have been consistent for the past month. Most channels are from the Tampa direction, but a few arrive from Orlando. We are very satisfied and really like NOT paying for cable or satellite. The picture quality has been excellent.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV, especially for the price!
Reviews.Author: R. Precourt
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with this purchase.  I already own a 60" Aquos TV that I've had for a couple years and love.  I decided to get a 32" TV for my home office and after trying a few different models settled on this one.Overall the picture is great, with very good contrast ratio (very deep blacks and bright whites.)  It doesn't have the best viewing angle I've seen, but it's acceptable (you loose a little of the color depth if you sit off-center.)  Also, the backlight uniformity is not perfect and while I wish it was better, it is acceptable for me.I agree with other reviewers that the sound quality from the built-in speakers is not great, but I am using an external sound system so I never use the TV speakers anyway.It seems well made and I've found that Sharp products have been reliable in the past, so this seems like a good choice.I had been a big Samsung fan in the past and had seen a Samsung model that I think may have had a better picture than this one, but I have experienced too many problems with their TVs failing (both my own and many other friends) all due to inferior parts being used, usually causing the power supply boards to fail.  Furthermore, their response to these problems is worse than the problems themselves.Overall, I am very happy with this TV and would definitely recommend it, with the only reservation being the sound if you plan to use the built-in speakers.

Reviews.Title: fantastic value ! great picture and color balance!
Reviews.Author: dogonpremise "dogonpremise"
Reviews.Content: love this tv, easy to set-up, great picture quality and nice design. would have liked more inputs, but that is whyone pay more i venture to guess.

Reviews.Title: Solid low-cost, name brand TV with VGA input
Reviews.Author: TiVoMaster "TiVoMaster"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV as a replacement for my grandmother's older flat panel that died.  I was looking for a name brand (I just prefer them, even for the low-end) entry-level with a low price point.  I got this tv for $260 pricematched to another website.  This was the only entry-level model which had a VGA input (she uses the TV as her PC monitor as well)...all the other name brand TV's seem to have eliminated VGA in their entry level.  The TV works well so far, good picture.  As the other reviewer mentioned, the sound is average, nothing spectacular.  Granny is pleased to have her TV back and thrilled at how cheap it was.

Reviews.Title: it is a good tv for decent viewing
Reviews.Author: Giovani L.
Reviews.Content: this a really budget so you shouldn't expect too much of this tv. considering the price it is quite good but the input had returning this tv. it was really uncomfortable arranging the connection because of where the input were placed. if you dont mind the inputs location then this a tv for a person who basically just likes watching tv and looking for a budget tv.

Reviews.Title: no good buy at all
Reviews.Author: neil
Reviews.Content: tv don't work is doesn't turn on have power but no picture or sound and that was suppose to be a return 1 after the first 1 comes damage i need technical help

Reviews.Title: still wondering
Reviews.Author: mark
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a new television set, and with all the makes and models out there it has become an increasingly difficult decision. I read reviews and wonder who writes them with all the bad grammar and mispronunciation. My guess is that these people writing reviews have spent their meager lives in front of a television set and have failed english class miserably. For gods sake people what is this world coming to..........internet, cell phones, and televisions? Open your minds and use some intelligence

3M:1 Dynamic Contrast Ratio
Thin Bezel Design
2 HDMI, 1 USB
TV without stand (Width x Height x Depth): 29-9/64" x 19-5/16" x 8-17/32" , TV with stand (Width x Height x Depth): 29-9/64" x 18-7/16" x 2-27/32"
ProductInfo.Name: Sharp LC-32LE450 32-inch 720p 60Hz LED HDTV
